page.description: Click the button to select a new style, or edit the existing style. You can also use <ProjectStyle> or <Session:varname>

discussion.p: The *[ui:Style name]* defines the style to use for the component. The style refers to a CSS style defined using the Style Builder. Alpha Anywhere ships with several pre-defined styles you can use in your applications.
The Style used by the UX Component can be explicitly defined (e.g. *[ui:Alpha]*) or use a dynamic reference. Dynamic references are evaluated at run-time.

item.name: Style_name
item.description: The name of a Local, Global, or System CSS style. EG: '*[xb:GrBlue]*', '*[xb:iOS7]*', '*[xb:Alpha]*'

item.name: <ProjectStyle>
item.description: Uses the *[ui:Project Style]* defined in [Web Project Properties].

item.name: <session:varname>
item.description: Use the style specified in the session variable "varname". EG: '*[xb:<session:var1>]*'.

item.name: Style_name:compact
item.description: For styles that support "compact". Use the compact version of the *[xb:Style_name]*. EG: '*[xb:<ProjectStyle>:compact]*' or '*[xb:Alpha:compact]*'

item.name: Style_name:notcompact
item.description: For styles that support "compact". Specifies that the component should not use the compact version of the *[xb:Style_name]*. EG: '*[xb:<ProjectStyle>:notcompact]*' or '*[xb:Alpha:notcompact]*'
